content: january socks allison rose sizes one size women s medium measurements 4 10cm foot width 8 20cm total circumference length is adjustable yarn mc 50g 191yds 175m of fingering weight yarn cc 5g 19yds 18m of fingering weight yarn sample is knit in mc sandes garn sisu in the color dark blue 6062 80% superwash wool 20% nylon cc sandes garn sisu in the color white 1001 80% superwash wool 20% nylon needles 2 5mm us 1 5 circular needles with a cable long enough for magic loop knitting or small enough for small circuference knitting or 2 5mm dpns gauge 32 stitches x 42 row = 4 x 4 10cm x 10 cm in stockinette in the round on 2 5mm needles additional materials 2 stitch markers optional tapestry needle techniques used german twisted cast-on stranded colorwork german short row picking up stitches decreasing kitchener bind-off if you have any questions about this pattern please feel free to contact @allisonroseshaw on instagram or email allisonrosecreates@gmail com if you share any pictures of work you make with this pattern on social media please tag me @ allisonroseshaw and use the hashtag #januarysocks - i d love to see what you make thank you 2 january socks by allison rose pattern the january socks are knit from the cuff down starting with a stretchy german twisted cast-on and a 1x1 rib cuff a stranded colorwork pattern is worked on the top edge of the sock followed by short row shaping to raise the back of the sock the heel is shaped using a heel flap and gusset with a french heel turn the remainder of the foot is knit in stockinette with a wedge toe and a kitchener bind off instructions are written for circular needles using the magic loop method abbreviations used throughout the pattern are explained on page 7 casting on & rib cuff cast-on 60 sts in the mc using the german twisted cast-on or your preferred stretchy cast-on of choice join to work in the round and divide so that you have 30sts on each needle video tutorial for the german twisted cast-on rounds 1-5 knit 5 rounds of 1x1 rib for the cuff *k1 p1* repeat * to * until end of round colorwork design the colorwork design is now worked on the cuff the colorwork chart is read bottom to top right to left round 1 knit one round rounds 2-10 knit the colorwork chart using the mc and cc the chart is work six times total around the circumference of the sock at the end of round 10 cut the cc yarn the rest of the sock is knit in the mc round 11 knit one round short row german short row are now worked to raise the back heel of the foot this short row section of the pattern will only work the first 30sts i e the stitches on your first needle video tutorial for german short row row 1 rs knit
